ovdesc.p: The generic charging structure for accounts or group of accounts or group of accounts in a particular currency is defined here. IC.CHARGE for a particular account is prefixed with 'A-' followed by account number, for a group prefixed with 'G-'. If needed to specify for accounts in a group with a particular currency - the id is defined as G-group.no-currency
The different charge products (IC.CHARGE.PRODUCT) with different capitalisation frequency, with different calculation period ( monthly or periodic) ,effective on different dates can be defined here.

The IC.CHARGE defined for a particular account overrides the IC.CHARGE defined for its group or/and group with its currency . Similarly if IC.CHARGE is defined for an account's group and account's group - its currency , the latter takes higher precedence.
Input is allowed in the field WAIVE.CHARGE only for IC.CHARGE defined for a particular account
When the field WAIVE.ALL has value 'YES' in it, the input into other fields are not allowed. Input is allowed in the field WAIVE.CHARGE only for IC.CHARGE defined for a particular account.

Indicate the Amortization method. Can be set to “” or END or SPECIAL. Based on the value set in this field, either daily straight line amortization would happen or the entire chage amount would be posted to P&L on the end date.

Identifies the generic charging structure table - IC.CHARGE .
IC.CHARGE can be defined for a particular account or a group of account or group of account with currency.
The id for IC.CHARGE for a particular account is defined as 'A-account number ' . Internal accounts are not allowed.
The id for IC.CHARGE for a particular group is defined as 'G-group number'
The id for IC.CHARGE for a particular group ,for a particular currency is defined as 'G-group number - currency'
Alpha numberic character
A- valid account number or G- valid group number (ACCT.GEN.CONDITION id) or G-valid group number - valid currency.

Defines the generic charge capitalising frequency that is the charge calculation period. This is a standard T24 frquency field, so charges can be capitalised at any time, though charges are normally capitalised monthly , quarterly, semi anually or annually.Needs to have a value when the field IC.CHG.PRODUCT has value. Care should be taken that the first date in the CHRG.FREQUENCY field is not less that the value in the CHRG.EFF.DATE field. if this occurs then charges will not be capitalised until the frequency field is changed.
Associated with the fields IC.CHG.PRODUCT , CAL.STEP.PERIOD,CHRG.EFF.DATE.
Input not allowed when WAIVE.ALL has value.

Standard T24 date field.

Oprional Input. Indicates whether non standard accrual / amortisation processing is required. Normal accrual/amortisation processing will begin on the period start date and finish 1 day before the period end date, i.e. no accrual takes place on the last day.

Optional input. Indicates whether the calculated charge is to be accrued or amortised. If a charge is to be amortised the P&L entry will be changed by the core accouting to a CRF CAP entry at the time the charge is booked. The P&L will than be amortised by the core accrual pocess up to the next charge date. If accrual is to take place the projected charge will be accrued over the next charge period and the P&L entry at the next charge date will also become a CRF CAP ENTRY. Any difference between the projected charge and the actual charge will result in an accrual adjustment at the end of the accrual period, i.e. when the customer account is debited.
Optional input allowed values "YES" or "NO".

Defines the calculation period for generic charge products .
This field specifies whether the charges defined in the charge products should be calculated once to cover the full charge period, as specified in the field CHRG.FREQUENCY or in monthly steps.

If ' M' (monthly) is specified the charges are calculated every month and the total charges is posted on the capitalisation date. If ' P' (periodic) is specified the charges are calculated for the whole capitalisation period.
Defaults to 'P'
